intro: Calochortus madrensis, commonly known as the Madrean fritillary, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as globemallow or mariposa lilies. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Calochortus madrensis is a perennial herb that often blooms in spring and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
